PLAYER ACTION: Not sure about the mechanics in the meantime - did Granny get a long rest? And just to know, was the ship repaired a bit in the meantime or will it steadily head towards 0 throughout the trip? You do get your long rest, since it takes 3 days for a long rest and 6 have passed. But remember, long rests not done in a city or an inn follow these rules > **__Slow Natural Healing__** > *Characters don't regain hit points at the end of a long rest. Instead, a character can spend Hit Dice to heal at the end of a long rest, just as with a short rest. Proper healing can be done by resting at an inn or seeking healing at a church.* Secondly, the ship cannot make repairs while not docked in a city such as Fort Lox Okay - so I could use the remaining spellslots I have for healing word, take LR to recover spellslots, and then use Hit Die for the remaining HP? - Player 2: *Her claws had begun to dig into the sides of the tough wall to make her way to the roof, but she stopped upon hearing the words that came from the masked man's mouth. Agreement? They had no agreement. And what did Player 3 mean by 'interest'? Surely he could not hold such power over her. And she hardly remembered owing him TWO life debts. Another claw into the wall. It did not matter. Another foot up. There was no debt... Gods, what is she doing? She cannot walk away from this. As if compelled by another force, she steps back down to the balcony and peers over its edge down at the imposing shadow. Her voice was faltering, frustrated, and clearly offended.* "One does not remember owing such a grave debt twice over to you, cryptic one! Nor does one share the blood of a Darkling, least of all when compared with your darker visage! Away! Away with your deception!" *Darkling. He must be losing his mind along with his strength. Darkling... Though she did feel as though her body were changing much more quickly. But age worked differently here, did it not? Still, Tree was young. Spry. Though she is unsure how many moons she holds here, as the Feywilds did not offer such an easy way to track one's days. But... why did she feel so much.. older?*
- Player 2: *She peers at the man. Curious what he means. Discretely, she tries to prepare to connect to the masked man's psyche.*

PLAYER ACTION: *So she doesn't remember does she? Interesting. No one bothered to tell her either. Poor thing. Hmm.... Sorry Sister. This vault is just a little tougher to crack than that. ||Silly cat. I've got a proposition for you and you don't even know it. Well, alright. If that's how it'll be. I know how to catch cats. The trick is to make them come to you||* "Alright Sister. I get it. You know what. We'll just leave it as an IOU. Hopefully we'll get around to it before you whither away. From the looks of it, I've got you paced on that though. Maybe we'll bat the yarn around before it runs out" *I turn and hand in pockets, begin to make my way down the street. I've never known a cat to pass on such a tasty morsel. Curiosity kills and all that* *Unexpectedly, her connection with the mysterious one's mind was severed before she had an attempt to read into it. It was as if a fortress guarded his inner workings. It frustrated her, but made her more curious. Expecting him to delve into his meaning here and there, she listens to his next words with a devilish glint in her eyes. But then he simply babbles more riddles and turns to walk away. From her! He gave chase and then gives up so easily? Why? What did he mean 'wither away'? What did he know that she did not? Why couldn't she hear his thoughts? What did his face look like? Rrghhhh, this was unbearable. It was terrible to not know, and even worse when the answers were so close. Quickly, she steps up on the balcony and jumps down, being careful to slow her fall to avoid an embarrassing tumble.*

RECENT CHAT:
- Player 24: Continues muttering, slightly more coherent now, and Player 26 swears she could hear something about 'the arch fey that stole her attention' and about 'why did I have to go get it back'. After a bit she takes a breath. "Of course, who's to say you won't.... you know... get bored of me? Or tired of my instability? Of course you did say..." She blushes again thinking about the context in which this was said. "You said... that uh... you wanted to go ttttt-to the wilds and... " She's unable to finish what Player 26 had told her in the river. "You know... what you said."
- Player 24: Hears the bump of head on street and nearly panics and instinctually reaches out and uses the spell False Life.... on herself. She looks at her hand, slightly confused, as the magic she had intended to use on Player 26 is instead applied to herself. She may have understood the joke before, but in her current 'situation' it was beyond her. Her nerves got the better of her as she looked about, worried that their conversation had been shared with some random stranger that may or may not have been standing nearby, and is relieved that they appear to still be alone. "You're right, I am obviously overthinking things... thinking too far ahead." She suddenly thinks of something, maybe a trickle of confidence from deep within that just can't be oppressed by her season. "You... could maybe even try it, and who knows, come around to my thoughts. Find someone else to share your love with, and bring them back to me to share together..." She also knew deep down she could do the same, but firstly had made the promise to never do so to Player 26, and right now was baffled at the idea that she would ever have the audacity to openly flirt in such a manner that could lead to that situation.

As soon as her autumn echo is summoned, it vanishes as Nua recognizes the voice. She turns and looks up at Riena, "Gods damn it, you frightened me" After a moment of allowing herself to calm down, she turns around in Riena's arms to face her. The halberd falls to the floor next to them as both hands grip Riena's suspenders and pulls her down into a deep kiss. After a few seconds, she pulls herself back and her eyes look away from Riena. She speaks, almost in a whisper in Elvish, ||"I.. I want you to fight me..."||, still not noticing how drunk Riena may or may not be, she can't quite look up at the woman before her. N:Nuathavel extends a hand out to her side. The Halbert on the ground shimmers before vanishing, only to appear again in her hand. She lowers her stance, holding the shaft so the tip is pointed toward the ground. Her eyes meet Riena's and despite her fierceness, there was a desperation in her shaking eyes. "No... I." She tightens her grasp on her weapon "I need to prove to you... no, to myself, that I don't need to be protected. That I have the strength needed to be able to go ||home||."
